decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to draw cards and fill the graveyard, along with spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to control the board, the deck aims to bring out Arclight Phoenix multiple times in a game for consistent pressure. Picklock Prankster adds additional value by creating tokens and providing extra damage. With efficient card selection and graveyard manipulation, this deck aims to outpace and outlast opponents in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

This Red Deck Wins Pioneer deck focuses on fast-paced aggression by utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, along with creature threats like Emberheart Challenger and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes powerful enchantments like Monstrous Rage and creatures with abilities that provide additional damage, like Kumano Faces Kakkazan. With a mix of removal spells and efficient creatures, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and deal damage efficiently to secure victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with Lotus Field and other lands to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Crumbling Vestige. It utilizes creatures like The Wandering Minstrel and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods to control the board and enable the combo. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Ipnu Rivulet for protection and disruption. By ramping up mana production and utilizing card draw effects like Glimpse the Core, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm opponents. This involves using key cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Parhelion II to generate value and control the game. Thoughtseize helps disrupt opponent's strategies while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency in executing the game plan.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins Pioneer deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monstrous Rage, Burst Lightning, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. Cards like Mutavault and Shadowspear provide additional utility and flexibility, while cards like Heartfire Hero and Reckless Rage offer removal and combat tricks to maintain board control. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through a combination of direct damage and creature aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to heavily utilize green mana symbols to build up devotion to green, enabling powerful effects from cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Cavalier of Thorns. The deck includes a mix of efficient mana dorks and resilient threats, along with disruptive cards like Invasion of Ixalan and Leyline of the Guildpact to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner provides card draw and ramp, while Storm the Festival can help refill the board with threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive green creatures and devotion synergy.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly by ramping up Lotus Field with cards like Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands. It also aims to dig through the deck efficiently with cards like Consider and Pore Over the Pages to find combo pieces and finish the game with a big explosion of spells. The key strategy is to set up a powerful board state while manipulating the library to ensure a successful combo sequence that will overwhelm the opponent in a single turn.

The main focus of this deck is to apply heavy pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodtithe Harvester with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, the deck aims to quickly take control of the game and force the opponent on the defensive. Utilizing a mix of direct damage and board control, the Rakdos Aggro archetype seeks to end the game as quickly as possible while staying ahead in tempo and card advantage.
